completed or implemented.

achieved.

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any

ALLEGATIONS:
Vista Maria did not provide Foster Parent 1 with Foster Child N’s medical
authorization card within 7 days of placement.
No mental health screening (ASQ) was completed on Foster Child N within 30
days of placement.
Two foster home visits were not completed within 30 days after Foster Child N
was replaced in Foster Parent 1’s home.
Agency did not provide Foster Parent 1 with appropriate documentation
preparation prior to Foster Child N’s placement.
Agency did not document in Foster Child N’s record the required information
within 7 days after placement.
Agency did not ensure Foster Child N was enrolled in school within 5 days of
placement.
Agency did not ensure Foster Child N had/has sufficient clothing.
3

Foster Parent 1 has not been paid for Foster Child N.
INVESTIGATION:
Foster Child N, age 15, was placed in the home of Foster Parent 1 on 4/2/21. This was
an emergency placement intended to be a respite. Foster Child N remained in the
foster home beyond 14 days. As of 4/17/21, the placement was no longer considered a
respite.
On 5/13/21, DCWL received an online complaint alleging the above against Vista Maria.
Foster Child N was removed from Foster Parent 1’s home on 5/17/21.
I notified Vista Maria’s Chief Administrator, Quality Manager and Foster Care Program
Manager of the complaint and requested the following documents:
1) Verification that Foster Child N’s medical authorization card was given to Foster
Parent 1 upon placement.
2) Verification that a mental health screening of Foster Child N was completed
within 30 days after placement.
3) Verification of placement documentation provided to Foster Parent 1 upon
placement and/or within 7 days after placement.
4) Verification that Foster Child N was enrolled in school within 5 days of
placement.
5) Proof that Foster Parent 1 has received payment for Foster Child N.
As of 5/24/21, Vista Maria provided documentation that Foster Parent 1 has received
payment for Foster Child N and noted Foster Child N was still enrolled in his original
school at the time he was placed with Foster Parent 1. The other documents were not
provided.
The Program Manager reported that three different foster care workers were
assigned to Foster Child N’s case from 4/2/21 – 5/13/21. As of 5/24/21, MISACWIS
only showed one case contact occurred between a Vista Maria foster care worker,
the child and the foster parent on the date of placement (4/2/21). The Program
Manager indicated the original assigned foster care worker observed the child with
two duffle bags full of clothing at the time of placement, and neither the foster child
nor the foster parents have complained of him needing clothing or made a clothing
request.
Case notes indicate Foster Parent 1 notified the foster care worker twice that Foster
Child N was self-harming and experiencing “panic attacks.” There was no evidence
that the worker referred him for a mental health assessment or treatment.
4

APPLICABLE POLICY
FOM 801, pg 1 Mental health screening
A mental health screening is to be completed within 30
days after placement.
ANALYSIS: Case notes indicate Foster Parent 1 notified the foster care
worker twice that Foster Child N was self-harming and
experiencing panic attacks. No mental health screening was
conducted by the foster care worker. No referrals for a mental
health assessment or mental health treatment were made.
CONCLUSION: POLICY NON-COMPLIANCE ESTABLISHED
(repeat from audits of 2019 & 2020)
APPLICABLE POLICY
FOM 801, pg 17 Medical authorization card
The care provider shall be given the Medicaid number and
medical authorization card upon placement.
ANALYSIS: Foster Parent 1 was not given Foster Child N’s medical
authorization card upon placement.
CONCLUSION: POLICY NON-COMPLIANCE ESTABLISHED
APPLICABLE POLICY
FOM 722-06H, Caseworker contact with child in out of home placement
pg 5
The caseworker must have at least two face-to-face
contacts per month with the child for the first two months
following an initial placement or a placement move.
ANALYSIS: The caseworker did not meet with the child twice during the first
month of his official placement (between 4/17 & 5/17).
CONCLUSION: POLICY NON-COMPLIANCE ESTABLISHED
5

APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.12207 Staff responsibilities.
(3) An agency shall require that social service workers be
directly responsible for all of the following activities:
(a) Placing and supervising children in out-of-home care.
Social service workers shall work directly with the children,
their families, and other relevant individuals and be
primarily responsible for the development, implementation,
and review of service plans for the children and their
families.
ANALYSIS: Social work contacts show that one of Foster Child N’s three
assigned case workers had regular email and phone contact
with Foster Parent N during the first 30 days after his placement.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.12404 Placement.
(6) Before the placement of a child, the agency shall
document preparation, regardless of the child's age, that
explains all of the following to all relevant parties:
(b) The child's individual needs.
(c) Any special problems presented.
ANALYSIS: There was no documentation that Foster Child N’s individual
needs or any special presenting problems were documented
and explained to Foster Parent 1 before placement in her home
or within 7 days after the emergency placement became official.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.12411 Clothing policy.
An agency's clothing policy shall, at a minimum, ensure
that each foster child has a sufficient amount of clothing
that is appropriate as to size and season and that is in good
repair.
6

ANALYSIS: Program Manager indicated the foster care worker observed
Foster Child N with two duffle bags full of clothes at the time of
his admission on 4/2/21. Neither the foster child nor foster
parent complained or requested additional clothing as of
5/13/21.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.12409 Education.
An agency's education policy shall ensure that, within 5
school days of placement, an agency shall provide for the
enrollment of each child of school age, as defined by state
law, into a school program.
ANALYSIS: There was no documentation that Foster Child N was enrolled in
school by 4/7/21 or within 5 days of replacement.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.12404 Placement.
(7) An agency shall document, in the child’s record within 7
days after placement the information specified in R
400.12417(1) and all of the following:
(a) All of the following child characteristics
(i) Gender.
(ii) Race.
(iii) Height and weight.
(iv) Eye color and hair color.
(v) Identifying marks.
(vi) Religious preference.
(vii) School status, including grade, last school
attended, and educational program.
(b)Name, known addresses, and marital status of the
child’s parents or legal guardian, if any.
(c) Names, ages, and known addresses of siblings.
7

(d)Known names, addresses and dates of any previous
out of home placements.
(g) Documentation of the child’s placement preparation.
ANALYSIS: There was no initial placement outline documenting the above
information within 7 days after placement.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
(repeat from audits in 2019 & 2020)
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.12417 Foster parent information.
(1) An agency shall provide a foster parent with all of the
following information before the placement or replacement
of a child:
(d) Any known history of abuse or neglect of the child.
(e) All known emotional and psychological factors
relating to the care of the child.
(f) All known behaviors of the child.
(2) For an emergency placement, if any of the information
specified in subrule (1)(a) to (h) of this rule is not available
at the time of placement, then the agency shall provide
information to the foster parent within 7 calendar days of
the placement.
ANALYSIS: Although Program Manager stated the foster care worker
provided all of the above information verbally to Foster Parent N
at the time of placement, there was not documentation that this
occurred at the time of placement or within 7 days after.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
ADDITIONAL FINDING:
8

As of 5/24/21, a USP submitted on 5/6/21 has not been approved by the foster
care supervisor.
INVESTIGATION:
MISACWIS shows an outstanding USP that was not approved by the foster care
supervisor timely.
APPLICABLE POLICY
FOM 722-09, Supervisor’s signature on USP
pg 27
The supervisor must sign and approve USPs within 14 days
of the report being written.
ANALYSIS: MISACWIS indicates Foster Child N’s USP was submitted on
5/6/21. Supervisory approval/signature was required by
5/20/21. As of 5/24/21, the report had not been approved by the
foster care supervisor.
CONCLUSION: POLICY NON-COMPLIANCE ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Once an acceptable corrective action plan is received, I recommend this facility
continue its current licensing status.
